item.title: A little talk about Java
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

That’s true, never hurts to delete old java versions unless you’re a developer testing compatibility.

Read full topic

item.title: A little talk about Java
item.dc:creator: @Encryption Encryption
item.description:
@Encryption wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:7, topic:534586”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=653382.msg4378042#msg4378042 date=1382651947]
this sounds like bullshit to me… I could be completely wrong about how this works, but…

He is basically going on about how Java keeps older versions on your computer blah blah blah… but if they have access to run your installed programs aren’t you already vulnerable? obviously there are java drive by’s and stuff, but I dont think that has anything to do with older versions
[/quote]Yeah it’d be nice if he’d actually explained some of these exploits instead of acting like each one is some sort of überhack that will take down entire enterprises.[/quote]

Honestly if he were to explain, or show exploits that would give someone the idea in order to use those exploits, or try to find his own. I’m sure many have after watching this vedo. I thought I’d just let the community know always update your java files, and delete the previous versions. It also wouldn’t hurt to update your JDK.

Read full topic

item.title: A little talk about Java
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

You should always delete the old java files first anyway… ( uninstall/whatever)

-Why use java 7? Just use most up to date java 6 as there are no updates and makes it so no compiler issues about major minor happen for noobs

Read full topic
